# The `LegalizeBufferContentTypesVisitor` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Convert loads/stores of types that the buffer intrinsics can&#39;t handle into one ore more such loads/stores that consist of legal types. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Convert loads/stores of types that the buffer intrinsics can&#39;t handle into one ore more such loads/stores that consist of legal types.

Do this by
<ul>
<li>Recursing into structs (and arrays that don&#39;t share a memory layout with vectors) since the intrinsics can&#39;t handle complex types.</li>
<li>Converting arrays of non-aggregate, byte-sized types into their corresponding vectors</li>
<li>Bitcasting unsupported types, namely overly-long scalars and byte vectors, into vectors of supported types.</li>
<li>Splitting up excessively long reads/writes into multiple operations.</li>
</ul>


Note that this doesn&#39;t handle complex data strucures, but, in the future, the aggregate load splitter from SROA could be refactored to allow for that case.

Definition at line 616 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpulowerbufferfatpointers-cpp">AMDGPULowerBufferFatPointers.cpp</a>.

### getVecSlices() {#aeb7009bf80743003a71ab4cf1e404b66}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LegalizeBufferContentTypesVisitor::getVecSlices (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; T, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; VecSlice &gt; &amp; Slices)</>}>
Return the &#91;index, length&#93; pairs into which <code>T</code> needs to be cut to form legal buffer load or store operations.

Clears <code>Slices</code>. Creates an empty <code>Slices</code> for non-vector inputs and creates one slice if no slicing will be needed.

### intrinsicTypeFor() {#a0bc47d2e7173c15b81ca5e945a75c404}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Type &#42; LegalizeBufferContentTypesVisitor::intrinsicTypeFor (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; LegalType)</>}>
In most cases, return <code>LegalType</code>.

However, when given an input that would normally be a legal type for the buffer intrinsics to return but that isn&#39;t hooked up through <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a>, return a type of the same width that can be used with the relevant intrinsics. Specifically, handle the cases:
<ul>
<li>&lt;1 x T&gt; =&gt; T for all T</li>
<li>&lt;N x i8&gt; &lt;=&gt; i16, i32, 2xi32, 4xi32 (as needed)</li>
<li>&lt;N x T&gt; where T is under 32 bits and the total size is 96 bits &lt;=&gt; &lt;3 x i32&gt;</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpulowerbufferfatpointers-cpp/#l00663">663</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpulowerbufferfatpointers-cpp">AMDGPULowerBufferFatPointers.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### legalNonAggregateFor() {#a5305a762c1528a47b528ca62c3db2a96}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Type &#42; LegalizeBufferContentTypesVisitor::legalNonAggregateFor (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; T)</>}>
Break up the loads of a struct into the loads of its components.

Convert a vector or scalar type that can&#39;t be operated on by buffer intrinsics to one that would be legal through bitcasts and/or truncation. Uses the wider of i32, i16, or i8 where possible.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpulowerbufferfatpointers-cpp/#l00635">635</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpulowerbufferfatpointers-cpp">AMDGPULowerBufferFatPointers.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
